analysis.Summary: ProfileLikes.vue is a Vue page component that renders a 'Likes' section on a user’s profile. It displays a header, a Tab control to switch between 'My posts' and 'Following', synchronizes the selected tab with the URL query parameter, and conditionally renders a Feed of liked posts.
analysis.Purpose: Provide the UI for browsing a user's liked content (posts or hubs) within the profile section of the application, keeping the current tab in sync with the URL for bookmarking and navigation.

Components.name: Tab
Components.responsibility: Renders a tabbed navigation control, allows selection between 'My posts' and 'Following', and exposes v-model:selected for two-way binding of the active tab.

Components.name: Feed
Components.responsibility: Displays a feed of items (in this case, the user's liked posts) based on the provided user/owner ID.

Functions.name: watchTabOrganization
Functions.description: Watches changes to the reactive ref tabOrganization and updates the route’s query parameter 'tab' via router.replace so that the URL stays in sync with the UI.

parameters.name: newValue
parameters.description: The newly selected tab value ('posts' or 'hubs').

analysis.Usage: This component is imported into the router configuration (e.g. under a route like '/profile/:_id/likes') and rendered when the user navigates to their Likes page. The route params and query drive its behavior.
Notes: Uses <script setup> syntax for a lean component definition.
Directly mutates route.query.tab to initialize the tab state—while effective, it relies on mutable query objects.
Only the 'posts' tab renders a Feed component; no UI is provided yet for the 'hubs' tab within this template.
No <style> block is defined locally; styling comes from global or parent styles.
